issues.message: Untrusted URL redirection depends on a [user-provided value](1).

rule.name: js/client-side-unvalidated-url-redirection
rule.full_description: Client-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

issues.message: '[https://aka.ms/js-track2-quickstart](1)' can be anywhere in the URL, and arbitrary hosts may come before or after it.

rule.name: js/incomplete-url-substring-sanitization
rule.full_description: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

issues.message: This does not escape backslash characters in the input.

rule.name: js/incomplete-sanitization
rule.full_description: A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a meta-character may be ineffective.

issues.message: This self-closing HTML tag expansion invalidates prior sanitization as [this regular expression](1) may match part of an attribute value.

rule.name: js/unsafe-html-expansion
rule.short_description: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
rule.full_description: Using regular expressions to expand self-closing HTML tags may lead to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

issues.message: This string may still contain [<script](1), which may cause an HTML element injection vulnerability.

rule.name: js/incomplete-multi-character-sanitization
rule.full_description: A sanitizer that removes a sequence of characters may reintroduce the dangerous sequence.

issues.message: This assignment may alter Object.prototype if a malicious '__proto__' string is injected from [user controlled input](1).

rule.name: js/prototype-polluting-assignment
rule.full_description: Modifying an object obtained via a user-controlled property name may lead to accidental mutation of the built-in Object prototype, and possibly escalate to remote code execution or cross-site scripting.

issues.message: This shell command depends on an uncontrolled [file name](1).

rule.name: js/shell-command-injection-from-environment
rule.short_description: Shell command built from environment values
rule.full_description: Building a shell command string with values from the enclosing environment may cause subtle bugs or vulnerabilities.

issues.message: This shell command depends on an uncontrolled [file name](1).

rule.name: js/shell-command-injection-from-environment
rule.short_description: Shell command built from environment values
rule.full_description: Building a shell command string with values from the enclosing environment may cause subtle bugs or vulnerabilities.

issues.message: [DOM text](1) is reinterpreted as HTML without escaping meta-characters.

rule.name: js/xss-through-dom
rule.full_description: Reinterpreting text from the DOM as HTML can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

issues.message:
Potential XSS vulnerability in the ['$.fn.validate' plugin](1).
Potential XSS vulnerability in the ['$.fn.rules' plugin](2).

rule.name: js/unsafe-jquery-plugin
rule.full_description: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

issues.message:
Potential XSS vulnerability in the ['$.fn.validate' plugin](1).
Potential XSS vulnerability in the ['$.fn.rules' plugin](2).

rule.name: js/unsafe-jquery-plugin
rule.full_description: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

issues.message: This part of the regular expression may cause exponential backtracking on strings starting with 'ftp://' and containing many repetitions of '0.0.'.

rule.name: js/redos
rule.full_description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

issues.message: This part of the regular expression may cause exponential backtracking on strings starting with 'ftp://a' and containing many repetitions of '0.0'.

rule.name: js/redos
rule.full_description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

issues.message: This part of the regular expression may cause exponential backtracking on strings starting with '//0.' and containing many repetitions of '00.'.

rule.name: js/redos
rule.full_description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

issues.message: This [regular expression](1) that depends on [library input](2) may run slow on strings with many repetitions of '0'.

rule.name: js/polynomial-redos
rule.short_description: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
rule.full_description: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

issues.message:
This [regular expression](1) that depends on [library input](2) may run slow on strings starting with 'specification/' and with many repetitions of 'specification/'.
This [regular expression](3) that depends on [library input](2) may run slow on strings starting with 'specification//examples/' and with many repetitions of '/examples/'.

rule.name: js/polynomial-redos
rule.short_description: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
rule.full_description: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

issues.message: The file may have changed since it [was checked](1).

rule.name: js/file-system-race
rule.full_description: Separately checking the state of a file before operating on it may allow an attacker to modify the file between the two operations.

issues.message: Postmessage handler has no origin check.

rule.name: js/missing-origin-check
rule.full_description: Missing origin verification in a `postMessage` handler allows any windows to send arbitrary data to the handler.

issues.message: This command depends on an unsanitized [command-line argument](1).

rule.name: js/indirect-command-line-injection
rule.full_description: Forwarding command-line arguments to a child process executed within a shell may indirectly introduce command-line injection vulnerabilities.
